column4: I set up ethernet properly on this comp (it wouldnt work for windows), so now the wireless card is in my XP machine
Maybe a few weeks ago, smi|e.
Alex[RM-UK] , I have never installed kubuntu, I was just stating the obvious
how do I get .rm files to play in totem-xine?
I just went thru that last night :)
so you have advice for me then?
first question: do you have w32codecs?
i don't know... i can play mpegs and avis and whatnot
look in .gnome2/totem-addons; you need a bunch of links to dll's and .so's in there. the .so's are for real media
I searched synaptic and found w32codecs... it wasn't installed so I'm installing it
totem-xine will populate totem-addons for you when you run it, and you should be good to go
however, I had some other issues, so if you have problems, ping me.
